verses.kjv: And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.
verses.web: He looked up and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.
verses.ct: Jesus looked up and watched the wealthy dropping their gifts into the temple treasury.

verses.kjv: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.
verses.web: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.
verses.ct: Then he noticed a poor widow put in 2 small copper coins.

verses.kjv: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:
verses.web: He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them,
verses.ct: He said, "I'm telling you the truth — this poor widow has given more than all of them.

verses.kjv: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.
verses.web: for all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”
verses.ct: Everyone else gave out of their surplus, but she gave out of her poverty — every last penny she had to live on."

verses.kjv: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,
verses.web: As some were talking about the temple and how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts, he said,
verses.ct: Some of his followers were admiring the temple, talking about its beautiful stonework and the gifts that decorated it. Jesus said,

verses.kjv: As for these things which ye behold, the days will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
verses.web: “As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.”
verses.ct: "These things you're looking at? The day is coming when not a single stone will be left standing on another. Every one of them will be torn down."

verses.kjv: And they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass?
verses.web: They asked him, “Teacher, so when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?”
verses.ct: They asked him, "Teacher, when will this happen? What sign should we look for to know it's about to take place?"

verses.kjv: And he said, Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.
verses.web: He said, “Watch out that you don’t get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don’t follow them.
verses.ct: He said, "Be careful not to be deceived. Many will come using my name, claiming, 'I am Christ,' and saying, 'The time has come!' Don't follow them.

verses.kjv: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions, be not terrified: for these things must first come to pass; but the end is not by and by.
verses.web: When you hear of wars and disturbances, don’t be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won’t come immediately.”
verses.ct: When you hear about wars and uprisings, don't panic. These things have to happen first, but the end won't come right away."

verses.kjv: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:
verses.web: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

verses.kjv: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and famines, and pestilences; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven.
verses.web: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.
verses.ct: There will be massive earthquakes, famines, and plagues in many places. Terrifying events and powerful signs will appear in the sky.

verses.kjv: But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues, and into prisons, being brought before kings and rulers for my name’s sake.
verses.web: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.
verses.ct: But before any of that happens, people will seize you and persecute you. They'll drag you into synagogues and throw you in prison. You'll be brought before kings and governors because of my name.

verses.kjv: And it shall turn to you for a testimony.
verses.web: It will turn out as a testimony for you.
verses.ct: This will give you the chance to share your testimony.

verses.kjv: Settle it therefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:
verses.web: Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer,
verses.ct: So make up your minds right now not to rehearse your defense ahead of time,

verses.kjv: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist.
verses.web: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.
verses.ct: because I will give you the words and the wisdom that none of your enemies will be able to argue against or refute.

verses.kjv: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolks, and friends; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death.
verses.web: You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.
verses.ct: You'll be betrayed by your own parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. Some of you will even be put to death.

verses.kjv: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake.
verses.web: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake.
verses.ct: Everyone will hate you because of my name.

verses.kjv: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.
verses.web: And not a hair of your head will perish.
verses.ct: But not a single hair on your head will be lost forever.

verses.kjv: In your patience possess ye your souls.
verses.web: “By your endurance you will win your lives.
verses.ct: Stand firm, and you will win your souls.

verses.kjv: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that the desolation thereof is nigh.
verses.web: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.
verses.ct: "When you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, you'll know its destruction is near.

verses.kjv: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto.
verses.web: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the middle of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.
verses.ct: At that point, anyone in Judea should flee to the mountains. Anyone inside the city should get out. Anyone in the countryside should not go into the city.

verses.kjv: For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
verses.web: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
verses.ct: Those will be days of vengeance, when everything written in Scripture will be fulfilled.

verses.kjv: But woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck, in those days! for there shall be great distress in the land, and wrath upon this people.
verses.web: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for pregnant women and nursing mothers in those days! There will be overwhelming suffering across the land and fierce judgment on this people.

verses.kjv: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led away captive into all nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.
verses.web: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.ct: They will be killed by the sword and taken as prisoners to every nation. Jerusalem will be trampled by the Gentiles until the era of the Gentiles comes to an end.

verses.kjv: And there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the sea and the waves roaring;
verses.web: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves;
verses.ct: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars. On earth, nations will be gripped with panic and confusion as the seas rage and roar.

verses.kjv: Men’s hearts failing them for fear, and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.
verses.web: men fainting for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.ct: People will faint from terror, dreading what is coming upon the world, because the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

verses.kjv: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.web: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.ct: Then everyone will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

verses.kjv: And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads; for your redemption draweth nigh.
verses.web: But when these things begin to happen, look up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”
verses.ct: When these things start to happen, stand up and lift your heads high, because your redemption is drawing near."

verses.kjv: And he spake to them a parable; Behold the fig tree, and all the trees;
verses.web: He told them a parable. “See the fig tree and all the trees.
verses.ct: Then he gave them an illustration: "Look at the fig tree — or any tree, for that matter.

verses.kjv: When they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand.
verses.web: When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.
verses.ct: When you see the leaves starting to bud, you know for yourselves that summer is almost here.

verses.kjv: So likewise ye, when ye see these things come to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand.
verses.web: Even so you also, when you see these things happening, know that God’s Kingdom is near.
verses.ct: In the same way, when you see all these things happening, you'll know that the kingdom of God is near.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all things are accomplished.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: this generation will not pass away until all of this has taken place.

verses.kjv: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
verses.web: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.
verses.ct: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

verses.kjv: And take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and so that day come upon you unawares.
verses.web: “So be careful, or your hearts will be loaded down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day will come on you suddenly.
verses.ct: "Watch yourselves. Don't let your hearts get weighed down with wild living, drunkenness, and the worries of everyday life, or that day will catch you completely off guard.

verses.kjv: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.
verses.web: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.
verses.ct: It will spring like a trap on everyone living on the face of the earth.

verses.kjv: Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.
verses.web: Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.ct: Stay alert at all times, and pray that you'll have the strength to escape everything that's coming and to stand before the Son of Man."

verses.kjv: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives.
verses.web: Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet.
verses.ct: During the day, Jesus taught in the temple. Each evening, he left the city and spent the night on the Mount of Olives.

verses.kjv: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.
verses.web: All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.
verses.ct: Every morning, all the people came to the temple early to hear him.
